title: Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 24 of 2024)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Jobseeker’s
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Jobseeker’s 

Pay-Related Benefit) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 15) (Jobseeker’s Pay-Related 
Benefit) Regulations 2024 shall be construed together as one and may be cited 
together as Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
(Amendment) (No. 15) (Jobseeker’s Pay-Related Benefit) Regulations 2024. 

Commencement
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited social welfare (jobseeker pay-related benefit) regulation 2024 (2) regulation social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) (amendment) (no 15) (jobseeker pay-related benefit) regulation 2024 shall construed together one may cited together social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) (amendment) (no 15) (jobseeker pay-related benefit) regulation 2024 commencement

title: Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 24 of 2024)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 31 March 2025.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations come into operation on 31 March 2025. 

Jobseeker’s Pay-Related Benefit
text_norm: 2 regulation come operation 31 march 2025 jobseeker pay-related benefit

title: Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 24 of 2024)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
(Amendment) (No. 15) (Jobseeker’s Pay-Related Benefit) Regulations 2024 
(No. 635 of 2024) are amended in article 5(b) by the substitution of the 
following: 

“Duration 

52HJ. (1) For the purposes of section 68KF(3) the following shall apply: 

(a) 

(b) 

the number of weeks prescribed for the purposes of section 
68KF(3) shall be 13, and this may include weeks where the 
person is in receipt of jobseeker’s benefit, jobseeker’s 
benefit (self-employed) or jobseeker’s allowance. 

in relation to a person entitled to payment of jobseeker’s 
pay-related benefit, any 2 or more consecutive applicable 
weeks separated by such number of weeks that they are – 

(i) 

in receipt of maternity benefit, 

(ii) 

in receipt of paternity benefit, 

(iii) 

in receipt of parent’s benefit, 

(iv) 

in receipt of adoptive benefit, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 13th December, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [689] 3 

(v) 

in receipt of health and safety benefit, 

(vi) 

in receipt of carer’s benefit, 

(vii) in receipt of illness benefit, 

(viii) in receipt of injury benefit, 

(ix) 

(x) 

taking additional maternity leave in accordance with 
the Maternity Protection Act 2024, 

taking such other statutory entitlement to leave or 
benefit as may be approved by or on behalf of the 
Minister from time to time, 

shall be treated as the same claim.” 

for 

“Duration 

52HJ. (1) For the purposes of section 68KF(3) the following shall apply: 

(a) 

(b) 

the number of weeks prescribed for the purposes of section 
68KF(3) shall be 13, and this may include weeks where the 
person is in receipt of jobseeker’s benefit, jobseeker’s 
benefit (self-employed) or jobseeker’s allowance. 

in relation to a person entitled to payment of jobseeker’s 
pay-related benefit, any 2 or more consecutive applicable 
weeks separated by such number of weeks that they are – 

(i) 

in receipt of maternity benefit, 

(ii) 

in receipt of paternity benefit, 

(iii) 

in receipt of parent’s benefit, 

(iv) 

in receipt of adoptive benefit, 

(v) 

in receipt of health and safety benefit, 

(vi) 

in receipt of carer’s benefit, 

(vii) in receipt of illness benefit, 

(viii) in receipt of injury benefit, 

(ix) 

(x) 

taking additional maternity leave in accordance with 
the Maternity Protection Act 2024, 

taking such other statutory entitlement to leave or 
benefit as may be approved by or on behalf of the 
Minister from time to time, 

(xi) shall be treated as the same claim.”. 

 
 
 
 4 [689] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

11 December, 2024. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [689] 5

title: Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 24 of 2024)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations make a technical amendment to correct a numbering error in 
the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) 
(No. 15) (Jobseeker’s Pay-Related Benefit) Regulations 2024 (No. 635 of 2024). 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [689]
